pydent.aqsession¶

Session class for interacting with Trident and Aquarium

This module defines the AqSession class, which is the main entry point for accessing Trident’s request methods. Multiple session instances can be created using a users Aquarium login information. From there, the session instance is used to make http requests (like finding models, updating plans, etc.)

AqSession creates SessionInterfaces which can make http requests to Aquarium but does not itself make the requests.

Interfaces are accessed by:

  1. session.<ModelName> - access the model interface
  2. session.create - access the create interface
  3. session.update - access the update interface

Functions

confirm([message]) Display a confirmation prompt.
prompt([message]) Get input from the user and return it.

Classes

AqHTTP(login, password, aquarium_url) Defines a session/connection to Aquarium.
AqSession(login, password, aquarium_url[, name]) Holds a AqHTTP with login information.
ModelInterface(model_name, aqhttp, session) Makes requests using AqHTTP that are model specific.
ModelRegistry(name, bases, selfdict) Stores a list of models that can be accessed by name.
UtilityInterface(aqhttp, session) Misc.
class pydent.aqsession.AqSession(login, password, aquarium_url, name=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Holds a AqHTTP with login information. Creates SessionInterfaces for models.

e.g.

session1 = AqSession(username, password, aquairum_url) session1.User.find(1)

<User(id=1,...)>
